com.cognifide.slice.mapper.api

Interface SliceReferencePathResolver

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SliceReferencePathResolverImpl

    @ConsumerType
public interface SliceReferencePathResolver
    Stores placeholders which are used to resolves paths used within SliceReference. It also resolve such paths by replacing stored placeholders by actual values.
    Author:
    maciej.majchrzak

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addPlaceholder(String placeholder, Class<? extends Annotation> annotationClass)
      Adds a placeholder and bind it to a specified annotation.
      void addPlaceholder(String placeholder, String directReference)
      Adds a placeholder and bind it to a specified String value (directReference).
      String resolvePlaceholdersInPath(String initialPath)
      Resolve the specified path by replacing all placeholders.

    • Method Detail

      • addPlaceholder

        void addPlaceholder(String placeholder,
                  Class<? extends Annotation> annotationClass)
        Adds a placeholder and bind it to a specified annotation. The specified annotation must be a BindingAnnotation and must be used for providing a String value by some module. Each placeholder stored using this method will be resolved by replacing it by a value returned by a provider of a String annotated with the specified annotation.
        Parameters:
        placeholder - placeholder which will be replaced in final path. It should NOT contain placeholder's prefix and suffix: ${ and } - it should be a simple text. Allowed characters are: letters, numbers, dash, underscore. E.g. "globalConfiguration"
        annotationClass - binding annotation which is used to provide a String value

      • addPlaceholder

        void addPlaceholder(String placeholder,
                  String directReference)
        Adds a placeholder and bind it to a specified String value (directReference). Since the placeholder will be replaced by the value specified in directReference, the directReference should be an absolute path.
        Parameters:
        placeholder - placeholder which will be replaced in final path. It should NOT contain placeholder's prefix and suffix: ${ and } - it should be a simple text. Allowed characters are: letters, numbers, dash, underscore. E.g. "globalConfiguration"
        directReference - value which will exactly replace the placeholder. E.g. "/content/test/en/configuration/global-configuration"

      • resolvePlaceholdersInPath

        String resolvePlaceholdersInPath(String initialPath)
        Resolve the specified path by replacing all placeholders. At first, there is an attempt to resolve placeholders using annotations. If a placeholder is not bound to any annotation, then there is an attempt to replace it by a String value specified by #addReference(String, String) method. If this attempt fails, the placeholder will not be resolved and the final path will contain it.
        Parameters:
        initialPath - path with placeholders to be replaced, e.g. "${globalConfigPage}/jcr:content/configComponent"
        Returns:
        a path with replaced placeholders, e.g. "/content/test/en/configuration/global-configuration/jcr:content/configComponent". Or a path containing placeholders which could not be resolved.
